controllerclass

Class picController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllerclass.picController

  • public class picController
extends java.lang.Object
    Class "picController" is a controllerclass. It controlls all processes that effects the dataclass picture its a list, that saves all pictures.

      • picCreate

        public picture picCreate(user Creator,
                         java.lang.String link)
        a new picture will be created and related to the creating user. Insert into list.
        Parameters:
        Creator - user, who creates the picture
        link - link to the picture
        Returns:
        created picture

      • picDelete

        Returns:

      • picComment

        public comment picComment(picture pic,
                          user autor,
                          java.lang.String newContent)
        creates a new comment and fills it with content. insert into comment list. sets related picture and user
        Parameters:
        pic - commented pic
        autor - commentator
        newContent - content of comment
        Returns:
        returns the created comment

      • picRate

        public int picRate(user rater)
        gets two random pics from list and have to choose the better one. actual the first one is always the better one (for testing)
        Parameters:
        rater - user who rates
        Returns:
        -1 = error, 0 is good

      • picRateWithPics

        public int picRateWithPics(user rater,
                           picture pic1,
                           picture pic2)
        user chooses the better one of the two pics. actual the first one is always the better one (for testing)
        Parameters:
        rater - user who rates
        pic1 - compared pic nr one
        pic2 - compared pic nr two
        Returns:
        -1 = error, 0 is good

      • printComments

        public int printComments(picture pic)
        prints all comments from a picture to console
        Parameters:
        pic - picture, where comments should printed
        Returns:
        -1 = error, 0 is good
